bwwExcerpt: Cynics may feel they're watching an animated civics lesson, but the play's plentiful humor drowns their doubts in laughter. Kaninâ€™s potent mix of mirth and truth is expertly served by Frank Wood as the glib, self-hating attorney, Terry Beaver as the uneasy Senator up for sale and Patricia Hodges as a sporty Congressional matron. Never removing his fedora in the 'cherce' role of the junkman's cousin and slavey, Michael McGrath lopes around like a guy out of Damon Runyon.
